name: market for diesel | diesel | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21230/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This inventory is based on the BR regional market of refined petroleum product dataset available in ecoinvent version 3.6 (2019), which was created as a copy (with adjusted uncertainty information) of the corresponding datasets for Europe without Switzerland in ecoinvent v3.4 (2017) within the SRI-LCI data collection projects. The original dataset for regional distribution of refined petroleum products was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2, and it was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3.;This dataset comprises transportation of product from the refinery to the end-user, operation of storage tanks and petrol stations, emissions from evaporation, and treatment of effluents. To update with primary data, only the transportation of diesel to the end-user is adapted. For this, it is considered the location of refineries; the amount of diesel imported in each port; the amount and location of diesel deliveries in 78 primary distribution points; and, the amount of diesel sold in each Brazilian city. ;This dataset was developed under the Cornerstone project, an initiative from the Brazilian Business Network on Life cycle Assessment (Rede ACV) in collaboration with ecoinvent to increase the quantity and quality of inventories that represent Brazil, through a thorough adaptation of the datasets. More information about this project is available in redeacv.org.br/en/wg-database 

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'diesel',  within the geography of Brazil.

This activity ends with the supply of 'diesel',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/19:Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products/192:Manufacture of refined petroleum products/1920:Manufacture of refined petroleum products

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Distribution distances were estimated for the year of 2018. The operation of storage tanks and petrol stations, emissions from evaporation, and treatment of effluents were extrapolated from the RER region (Most information for the year 2000. Split up of NMVOC emissions published 1989).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Weighted average distance (ton.km) per transport mode for delivering diesel from production and importing points to the end-user were estimated for the Brazilian market. The operation of storage tanks and petrol stations, emissions from evaporation, and treatment of effluents were extrapolated from the RER region (surveys mainly for DE and CH).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The operation of storage tanks and petrol stations, emissions from evaporation, and treatment of effluents were extrapolated from the RER region. Uncertainties were adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
The points of origin and destination, as well as the transport mode definitions, were based on the Strategic Logistic Corridor study from the Brazilian Ministry of Infrastructure (MI, 2020). First, distances and transport modes from refineries and diesel importing ports to the primary distribution points were defined (ANP, 2019; ANP, 2020a). Then, distances and transport modes were calculated for the transport leg between the primary distribution points to the cities where diesel is sold (ANP, 2020b). For the cities which together contribute up to 40% of total diesel consumption in Brazil, the actual distances and transport modes from primary distribution points were defined, for the remaining cities a distance of 100 km and transportation by lorry was assumed.

Main sources:

ANP, 2019. Agência Nacional do Petróleo, Gás Natural e Biocombustíveis. Anuário Estatístico 2019. Available at: anp.gov.br/publicacoes/anuario-estatistico/5237-anuario-estatistico-2019. Accessed in 04/06/2020

ANP, 2020a. Agência Nacional do Petróleo, Gás Natural e Biocombustíveis. Market data. Deliveries at distribution points inormation. Available at: anp.gov.br/distribuicao-e-revenda/distribuidor/combustiveis-liquidos/dados-de-mercado

ANP, 2020b. Agência Nacional do Petróleo, Gás Natural e Biocombustíveis. Statistical data. Slaes of petroleum products. Available at: anp.gov.br/dados-estatisticos

MI, 2020. Ministry of Infrastructure. Corredores Logísticos Estratégicos - Volume VI - Petróleo e Combustíveis. Available at: gov.br/infraestrutura/pt-br/assuntos/politica-e-planejamento/politica-e-planejamento/cle

dataGenerator.name: F. Valebona; T. B. Rocha; F. L. Motta

flow.name: diesel

exchanges.description: Comment found in the corresponding dataset for Europe without Switzerland in ecoinvent v3.4 (2017): Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

Calculated value. Origin and destination points and transport mode defined according to available diesel distribution infrastructure (MI, 2020). The amount of produced and imported diesel (ANP, 2019) was overlapped with the amount of diesel delivered in primary distribution points (ANP, 2020a) and the amount consumed in each Brazilian city (ANP, 2020b).

References:

ANP, 2019. Agência Nacional do Petróleo, Gás Natural e Biocombustíveis. Anuário Estatístico 2019. Available at: anp.gov.br/publicacoes/anuario-estatistico/5237-anuario-estatistico-2019. Accessed in 04/06/2020
